meanings: the minimum number of officers or members of a body that is required to be present at a given meeting ( as to transact business )
a select group
a body of the church of jesus christ of latter - day saints comprising those in the same grade of priesthood

examples: to introduce a strict import quota on grain
I'm going home now—I've done my quota of work for the day.
to get your full quota of sleep
meanings: a proportional part or share
the share or proportion assigned to each in a division or to each member of a body
the number or amount constituting a proportional share
fit for or worth quoting
fit for or worth quoting

examples: a dictionary of quotations
Two short quotations will illustrate my point.
The book began with a quotation from Goethe.
meanings: something that is quoted
a passage referred to, repeated, or adduced
the act or process of quoting

examples: to quote Shakespeare
He quoted a passage from the minister's speech.
They quoted from the Bible.
meanings: to speak or write ( a passage ) from another usually with credit acknowledgment
to repeat a passage from especially in substantiation or illustration
borrow sense 2 a

examples: their quotidian existence
meanings: occurring every day
belonging to each day: everyday
commonplace, ordinary
the number resulting from the division of one number by another
the numerical ratio usually multiplied by 1 0 0 between a test score and a standard value
quota, share
a standard english - language typewriter or computer keyboard on which the first six letters of the second row are q, w, e, r, t, andy
